Title: Mandarin / Japanese Bilingual Data Analyst - Ownership Data
CompanyDetails: S&P Global · Manila, National Capital Region, Philippines 2 weeks ago · 4 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
About the Role: Mandarin / Japanese Bilingual Data Analyst - Ownership Data

The Team

The Public Ownership team within the Deals, Ownership and Institutional Profiles Cluster (DOI) is primarily responsible for Collection, Linking and maintenance of the shareholdings data for publicly listed companies globally. Ownership data is sourced through different filings/ annual reports/exchange notifications and then linked to the respective owners.

Responsibilities And Impact

Be able to independently handle projects/workflows or any other task at hand delivering high quality and within deadlines 
Deep dive into data analysis of each allocated project and drive discussions to closure with stakeholders on workflow/procedure improvement through findings 
Deliver on predefined individual and team targets 
Understand the overall working of the dataset, be aware of the workflows and have strong working knowledge of work tools 
Identify new projects, lean/automation ideas, new policy proposals and enhancements as part of daily work 
Actively communicate and collaborate with other stakeholders within the ownership vertical 
Provides input and ideas for improving quality and product enhancements related to the covered content sets 
Assist in research for data/product initiatives. 
Troubleshoots problems or issues and provide support to the team 
Learning Exchange Courses as discussed with the manager and mandatory trainings on LX to be completed within deadline. 

What We’re Looking For

Bachelor’s degree preferably related to Finance or Business, or an equivalent work experience 
Must have at least an intermediate proficiency with Mandarin or Japanese language, 
Able to carry out day to day BAU work with minimal assistance. 
Analytical mindset and strong logical reasoning 
Intermediate technical Skills in Pathfinder and Excel 
Good interpersonal and strong communication skills 
Attention to detail, flexibility, and problem-solving abilities 
Solution-oriented mindset and ability to detect issues with solutions 
Client-centric mindset 
Good understanding of S&P Products such as Capital IQ Pro, Capital IQ, Excel Plug-Ins.

Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
CompanyDetails: Concentrix · Makati, National Capital Region, Philippines Reposted 3 months ago · 189 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
SENIOR BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST

Imagine being able to partner with global technology leaders in a company that cares about YOU – your professional growth, your success, and your community.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. Today.

We are Concentrix (formerly ServiceSource International PH). We are dedicated to creating success for our clients, the communities around us and each other. We provide outsourced inside sales, customer success, renewals management, and channel management solutions for the world's greatest brands. At Concentrix, you will be part of our diversified team that makes an impact for our clients. All of this is possible because of the talent you have to offer.

The future team member that will lead our decisions for customers and partners by developing and providing data through data analysis and by creating reports of patterns, insights and trends. Reporting to the Manager of Business Intelligence, You will mine data from a variety of data resources to design impact recommendations to our partners. The Business Intelligence Analyst will create specifications for reports and analysis based on in-depth assessment and understanding of our needs and data available. Along the way you will have access to excellent training opportunities to grow and enhance your skills and career.
At Concentrix, you can truly Own Your Future!

JOB REQUIREMENT: 
Proficient knowledge of expanded analysis tools (such as OLTP/OLAP data structures, Advanced Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets), Tableau, Salesforce, Power BI, Business Objects)
Proficient knowledge of domain languages (such as SQL Query, HIVE QL)
Apply moderately complex statistical methods (such as deviations, quartiles)
5 years of related experience to reflect skills and talent necessary for this role
Practical sales motion knowledge
Practical industry and demographic understanding in one of the following: (hardware, software, SaaS, healthcare or industrial)
Proficiency in all Microsoft products especially Word, Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets) and PowerPoint
Bachelor's Degree of Diploma in computer science, finance or statistics/mathematics
7+ years' experience in data-driven business insight recommendations, business analytics, dashboard design experience

JOB DESCRIPTION: 

Interpret moderately complex goals, trends, risks and areas for improvement by collecting, analyzing and reporting on key metrics and conclusions. May maintain integrity of reports and dashboards to allow business to operate
Use expanded solutions and knowledge to support customer teams and increase efficiency. Work on projects/matters of moderate complexity in an independent contributor role
Work and builds internal and external relationships to ensure high-quality data is available for analysis and better understanding
Develop data-driven insights to all partners
Engage daily with partners for planning, forecasting and gaining an understanding of questions for appropriate documentation and analysis
Work well independently and will seek counsel and guidance on more complex projects/matters. Work is generally reliable on routine tasks

Analytical Skills

Title: Product Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: NodeFlair - Tech Salaries, Jobs & more · Manila, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 month ago · 5 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
Job Description and Requirements:

Scope and Analyze:

 Analyze strategic questions and business opportunities in partnership with the product team.
 Collaborate with software engineers to integrate and implement the Matomo Analytics pipeline for flexible data access.
 Create and manage comprehensive tracking and tagging implementation strategies using Matomo Analytics.
 Support the product team in understanding performance by ensuring a connected and discoverable data ecosystem.


Technical Proficiency:

 Proven experience with Matomo Analytics: implementation, integration, management, designing, and building reports and dashboards.
 Strong competency in data analysis, data management, data modeling, and integration.
 Understanding of web analytics basics: tags, cookies, variables, data layer.
 Strong communication skills - both verbal and written, with the ability to simplify complex topics.


Ideal Qualifications:

 A grounding in mathematics and technology; a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, or a relevant STEM area is preferred.
 Experience with optimizing product funnels, running experiments, and building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes.
 Experience with Google Analytics and its implementation and configuration.


Insightful Contribution:

 Find insights that contribute to a deep understanding of products and customers.
 Suggest improvements based on insights to enhance metrics and measure the effects of released changes.


Dashboard Management:

 Build and maintain impactful and intuitive dashboards for the product team.
 Own projects, data models, dashboards, and other artifacts, ensuring they are up-to-date and of high quality.


Data Literacy Advocacy:

 Extend data literacy and curiosity throughout the product team.


**Note:**

We encourage creativity and insightfulness in analyzing data to provide valuable insights beyond conventional metrics. Ownership of projects and a commitment to maintaining high-quality data assets are key aspects of this role.

Title: Data Developer: Sr. Analyst - Knowledge Services
CompanyDetails: TASQ Staffing Solutions · Taguig, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 month ago · 2 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
Summary:-

This is a high profile role so the right candidate should be able to demonstrate expert knowledge of designing and producing effective data visualizations using multiple data sources. S/he would be the go-to expert for client delivery teams. S/He should also be able to train and mentor others to up-skill their capability in using visualization tools. 

The right candidate will be able to work independently and consult with client business users to deliver high quality interactive Dashboards for business needs. S/he should be passionate about solving business problems using data, think creatively and be able to engage with a broad set of stakeholders. 

Responsibilities:- 

Work with internal teams and client stakeholders to understand business goals, existing BI reports, KPIs, raw data sources and clarify visualization requirements / goals

Identify key business metrics measurements and develop ways to represent data in support of measurements

Determine the right graphs / charts to use based on the type of data and create visually smart dashboards that convey key insights in a concise and non-cluttered manner

Develop dashboards, automated reports and report templates using visualization tools this will be predominantly in Looker BI. Also use other tools such as Powe BI, Qlikview, Tableau, iDashboards, etc. when required

Create easy to understand interfaces for end users to quickly identify key themes in their data

Provide training to team members on use of data visualization and dashboard design best practices. 

Serve as a primary point of contact for any tool-based issue resolution

Understand the technical architecture to keep pace with changing business demands and new software releases

Work directly with end users to ensure results meet their needs

Qualifications:

5 years minimum in database management(with supervisory or leadership experience)

3 years in the BPO industry

3 years experience with Looker BI

Experience in SQL and database technologies (i.e. Oracle, mySQL, PostGreSQL) Reporting experience: PowerBI, Tableau

Work arrangement:

Onsite: BGC, Taguig

Night shift / Shifting

Title: Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: Arch Capital Services LLC · Quezon City, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 month ago · 15 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
At Arch, our goal is to provide talented people with a foundation where their skills are best leveraged and they get an opportunity to grow with us. Our diversified platform means there are a variety of opportunities to deploy your skill sets aligned to autonomy, mastery & purpose.
We seek creative and motivated individuals capable of working with complex products. Our unique underwriting platform, successful management team and strong capital base have enabled us to establish a prominent presence in the global insurance and reinsurance markets.
Knowledge of actuarial modeling techniques is a bonus. We embrace the collaboration necessary to innovate in today’s evolving marketplace; encourage participation and diversity of thought; and rely on talented, innovative individuals in all of the areas that are crucial to our success.
We are looking for an action oriented, depth focused, critical thinker who is able to take initiative and work collaboratively with matrix organizations. The individual will support the deployment & sustainment of initiatives with data collection, analysis, summary, recommendations monitoring and reporting that will help to drive repeatable problem solving and leadership routines.
  Deploy the volumetrics support for the successful deployment of LEAN practices, performance and visual management aligned to priority and required results.
Develop reporting and analysis tools to support Leaders and Teams to sustain continuous improvement in their area including their own management practices and routines.
Drive historical data trends, volume analysis, visual representations of KPIs and metrics to characterize all phases of the transformation and ongoing measurements/outcomes.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Build time-series forecasting models to predict optimal inventory levels with the ability to back test assumptions
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in data sets
Support and provide task administration to gathering data, create standard reports - dashboards, executive reports, inventory and intake, process maps, templates etc. 
Support Huddle formats, schedules, process confirm and weekly action summaries for team
 Diversity & Inclusion Aptitude
Ability to work well with a variety of different individuals 
Analytical Expertise with deep Technical knowledge
Data management, Pattern Analysis, Data organization
Data quality, Visual management and Presentation Skills
Strong Written & Verbal Communication Skills

Communication

Title: Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: TASQ Staffing Solutions · Makati, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 month ago · 12 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
As a Data Analyst, you will directly report to the Head of Data and Analytics and will be responsible for the design and development of data analysis and reporting to support the companys measuring business performance and providing automotive market insights.

What youll be working on:

Extract and transform raw data from multiple databases including excel spreadsheets, GCP BigQuery and/or Snowflake.

Deliver insightful, actionable, and timely reports by establishing reliable data sets, tools, and processes for repeatable results.

Understand the constraints around the source of the raw data and find solutions to maintain data integrity.

Develop daily, weekly, and monthly reports using dbt, SQL, Python and Tableau.

Prepare and maintain documentation such as business requirements documents, design specifications and test cases.

What were looking for:

2+ years experience in data warehousing, data analysis, and data visualization (Tableau, BigQuery/Snowflake).

2+ years experience in using ETL tools, Python, and SQL.

Able to report/present data with stakeholders, distill business requirement into data pipeline design, and reporting solution to collaborate ideas with the team

Able to demonstrate the ability to extract, analyze and edit large amounts of data.

Possess the ability to influence, establish and transform current workflow practices.

Comfortable in engaging with people and aligns with our company values

Dayshift

Location: Makati City

About the job
About Us

BlackHawk Industrial provides the highest quality industrial products and equipment, offering manufacturing services while creating innovative engineered supply solutions. We truly believe in the importance of the local relationships with the customers we service. Our employees have fun every day exceeding the expectations of our customers, suppliers, and shareholders. We are BIG ENOUGH TO SERVE, and SMALL ENOUGH TO CARE.

The Role

SUMMARY: The Sourcing Data Analyst is responsible for obtaining and negotiating cost and delivery for materials, supplies, and services for goods that have standard costs, quoted discounts, contracts, or make-to-order pricing.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Obtain product data from multiple suppliers & determine the best source to use in order to fulfill customer RFQs and implementations
Provide item data in a format to ensure efficient upload into the ERP system
Determine the best method to resolve problems ensuring customer satisfaction and adherence to company policies
Continually seek to streamline processes
Strive to stay up-to-date on information pertaining to commodities and communicate information to the rest of the team
Effectively communicates internally and externally
Maintain a clean, safe, and organized workspace
Perform other duties as assigned
Perform work in accordance to ISO processes and procedures

Ideal Profile

Qualifications

Knowledge of extrinsic factors relating to commodities purchased
Strong communication skills and interpersonal skills
Good math aptitude and detail oriented
Working knowledge of MS Outlook and MS Excel
Ability to exercise sound business judgment in a team environment while conveying a positive, service-oriented attitude
Ability to work on multiple projects with a high degree of accuracy
Strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently as well as within a team environment
With experience on MRO and Fastening is an advantage

What's on Offer?

Opportunity within a company with a solid track record of performance
Attractive Salary & Benefits
Fantastic work culture

Title: Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: Xurpas Enterprise · Manila, National Capital Region, Philippines 2 months ago · 15 applicants
JobDetails: PHP540,000/yr - PHP1,080,000/yr Hybrid Full-time Entry level
JobDescription:
About the job
At Xurpas Enterprise, we are driven by our goal to help organizations of all sizes successfully implement their digital transformation. We offer ready-made business solutions, custom software development, and IT staff outsourcing.

Our consultative, end-to-end process ensures that we provide the best possible solution to address your requirements.

The Role

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Develops, edits, and maintains IT performance measures and reports, as well as studies and internal business reports such as dashboards with key performance indicators for division-level reporting and decision-making.
Additional information: The position is assigned complex, journey-level assignments. The position works with stakeholders and customers to develop, edit, and ensure the ongoing maintenance of performance measures and reports such as maintaining the performance management repository, documenting method of calculation, method of collection, data source, etc.
Reviews and evaluates performance measures, data sources, methods of calculation, and methods of collection and makes recommendations for improvement to business practices.
Additional information: The position reviews the performance management repository and all of the performance measures of the team including documented methods of calculation, methods of collection, and data sources, and makes recommendations for improving the quality and accuracy of performance measures and reports, as well as the functions they measure or report on.
Researches, develops, and recommends measures to assess business problems and practices.
Additional information: Research, develop, and analyze ad hoc or other measures necessary to assess nonroutine business problems that require more understanding by executive leadership to resolve. This may include working with the Management to develop necessary reporting tools to complete the assignment and provide the needed information.
Communicates with stakeholders to ensure participation in the development of internal measures and performance reports.
Additional information: The position will be responsible for ensuring data is accurate and meets the needs of the team, this includes communicating with the group to ensure business requirements are gathered, as well as
coordinating with data owners to ensure the data is reputable and is an accurate reflection of the intended measure.
Informs management of results and recommendations from IT division performance reports and studies.
Additional information: Presents as necessary on research and data analysis results, routine reports, and ad hoc assignments. Audience may include IT management.
Ensures measures meet or exceed industry standards.
Additional information: The position may attend conferences, meet with counterparts at other agencies, research online, and follow emerging trends to ensure the performance measures and reporting tools are efficient, effective, and contemporary, meeting current industry standards.

Ideal Profile

Extensive experience with various Microsoft workstation Technologies (installation, administration, patching, tuning) particularly Microsoft Windows XP Professional, Windows 7, and Windows 10 Operating Systems
Knowledge of Unicenter Software Delivery (alias ITCM) or SSCM (or similar) and Asset Management experience preferred
Knowledge performance analysis.
Considerable knowledge of data analysis.
Programming/scripting experience required:

>Perl

>Powershell

>Power BI/SAP BI and other Business intelligence tools

>Login Group Policies scripting for AD

>VBScript

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Operations
CompanyDetails: TechnologyAdvice · Quezon City, National Capital Region, Philippines 3 weeks ago · 49 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
Hi, we're TechnologyAdvice.

At TechnologyAdvice, we pride ourselves on helping B2B tech buyers manage the complexity and risk of the buying process. We are a trusted source of information for tech buyers, delivering advice and facilitating connections between our buyers and the world's leading sellers of business technology.

Headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, we are a remote-first company with more than 20 digital publications and over 500 global team members in the US, UK, Singapore, Australia, and the Philippines. We're proud to have been repeatedly recognized as one of America's fastest growing private companies by Inc., as well as a Tennessee top workplace. We work hard each day and have fun, too, with monthly virtual events, recreational slack channels, and the occasional costumed dance from our CEO.

All positions are open to remote work unless otherwise specified in the requirements below.

Position Overview

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic Business Intelligence team! In this role, you will collaborate closely with our Analytics Engineers, Revenue Ops, Dev Ops, and Product teams. Your contributions will involve providing invaluable insights and actively participating in the construction, management, and optimization of systems and processes. These efforts aim to seamlessly collect, manage, and transform our data into meaningful insights. Your analytical prowess will play a pivotal role in informing our teams and contributing to the success of various interconnected systems.

Employment Level : Senior Level

Employment Type: Full Time

Working Hours: 10pm to 7am PHT (NOV-MAR)

What You'll Do

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand operational needs and implement data solutions accordingly. 
Develop, enhance, and streamline data pipelines and their corresponding architecture. 
Transform and curate large and intricate datasets to align with specific business requirements. 
Design and implement data validation techniques to ensure data accuracy and quality. 
Establish and optimize processes for data transformation, data structures, dependency management, and workload distribution. 
Collaborate with Business Stakeholders and the Business Intelligence team to address and fulfill data infrastructure requirements. 
Identify opportunities for scaling and optimizing data operations and implement effective strategies. 
Conduct thorough analyses to enhance operational efficiency and recommend improvements to existing processes. 
Create and maintain documentation for data operations processes and procedures. 
Cultivate engaging dashboards utilizing advanced visualization tools such as Tableau and Looker to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders. 

Who You Are

Advanced working knowledge of SQL (5-7 years of experience)
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker/Google Data Studio, Power BI, or similar platforms (3-5 years of experience)
Experience working with large relational databases
Working experience with AWS Redshift preferred and bonus points for Google BigQuery
Working experience with ETL tools, such as Fivetran and DBT
Experience with scripting languages: Python, Scala, etc. 
Must have a working laptop/pc and internet and back-up connection
Agile professional who excels in a fast-paced environment and thrives on continuously pivoting strategies to drive business needs forward
The duties and responsibilities listed above describe the post as it is in general terms and are not definitive. The job holder is expected to accept any reasonable alterations that may from time to time be necessary. ** 

What We Offer You

Our benefits and programs are designed to make your life better for you and your family..

Enrollment in Philippine statutory benefits
Healthcare reimbursement
Company holidays to include all regular holidays declared by the Philippine government
14 days annual paid time off
APAC First Friday speaker series where you can earn a bonus for presenting
Ongoing career development opportunities, mentorship program, and more

Work authorization

Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the Philippines at hire and must maintain authorization to work in the Philippines throughout their employment with our company.

Salary Range

TechnologyAdvice seeks to hire top-tier individuals across the world and intends for our compensation to be at a rate that allows us to recruit and retain individuals who align with our core values, purpose, mission, and vision.

Final total compensation is based on a multitude of factors including, but not limited to, skill level, relevant experience to the position, and cost of labor.

Monthly Pay Range

₱85,000—₱110,000 PHP

EOE statement

We believe that our differences make us stronger, and thus foster a diverse and inclusive culture where people feel safe being themselves. TechnologyAdvice is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.

Pre-employment screening required.

TechnologyAdvice does not engage with external staffing agencies. Any candidates introduced by such firms will not be eligible for compensation.

Title: Sales Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: SAMLEX Global Services · Iloilo, Western Visayas, Philippines 3 months ago · 7 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Analyst to join our team. As a Business Analyst, you will play a vital role in analyzing and interpreting data from our sales team to drive strategic business decisions. You will work closely with the sales department, identifying trends, patterns, and insights that will optimize sales performance and guide our overall business strategy.

Responsibilities

 Collaborate with the sales team to understand their goals, challenges, and data requirements.
 Collect, organize, and analyze sales data from various sources such as CRM systems, spreadsheets, and databases including reports from the Salesmen.
 Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop metrics to measure sales performance.
 Conduct in-depth analysis of sales data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement.
 Present findings and recommendations to management and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
 Develop models and forecasts to support sales planning and budgeting processes.
 Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of sales strategies and initiatives.
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions that enhance sales efficiency and effectiveness.
 Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to sales data analysis.

Requirements

 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
 Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role, preferably in a sales or marketing environment.
 Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, analyze, interpret complex data sets.
 Proficient in using data visualization tools such through Microsoft excel or any tools to present insights.
 Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and provide innovative solutions.
 Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
 Strong communication skills with the ability to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
 Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team.

Title: Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: Xurpas Enterprise · Makati, National Capital Region, Philippines 2 months ago · 8 applicants
JobDetails: PHP540,000/yr - PHP1,080,000/yr Hybrid Full-time Entry level
JobDescription:
About the job
At Xurpas Enterprise, we are driven by our goal to help organizations of all sizes successfully implement their digital transformation. We offer ready-made business solutions, custom software development, and IT staff outsourcing.

Our consultative, end-to-end process ensures that we provide the best possible solution to address your requirements.

The Role

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Develops, edits, and maintains IT performance measures and reports, as well as studies and internal business reports such as dashboards with key performance indicators for division-level reporting and decision-making.
Additional information: The position is assigned complex, journey-level assignments. The position works with stakeholders and customers to develop, edit, and ensure the ongoing maintenance of performance measures and reports such as maintaining the performance management repository, documenting method of calculation, method of collection, data source, etc.
Reviews and evaluates performance measures, data sources, methods of calculation, and methods of collection and makes recommendations for improvement to business practices.
Additional information: The position reviews the performance management repository and all of the performance measures of the team including documented methods of calculation, methods of collection, and data sources, and makes recommendations for improving the quality and accuracy of performance measures and reports, as well as the functions they measure or report on.
Researches, develops, and recommends measures to assess business problems and practices.
Additional information: Research, develop, and analyze ad hoc or other measures necessary to assess nonroutine business problems that require more understanding by executive leadership to resolve. This may include working with the Management to develop necessary reporting tools to complete the assignment and provide the needed information.
Communicates with stakeholders to ensure participation in the development of internal measures and performance reports.
Additional information: The position will be responsible for ensuring data is accurate and meets the needs of the team, this includes communicating with the group to ensure business requirements are gathered, as well as
coordinating with data owners to ensure the data is reputable and is an accurate reflection of the intended measure.
Informs management of results and recommendations from IT division performance reports and studies.
Additional information: Presents as necessary on research and data analysis results, routine reports, and ad hoc assignments. Audience may include IT management.
Ensures measures meet or exceed industry standards.
Additional information: The position may attend conferences, meet with counterparts at other agencies, research online, and follow emerging trends to ensure the performance measures and reporting tools are efficient, effective, and contemporary, meeting current industry standards.

Ideal Profile

Extensive experience with various Microsoft workstation Technologies (installation, administration, patching, tuning) particularly Microsoft Windows XP Professional, Windows 7, and Windows 10 Operating Systems
Knowledge of Unicenter Software Delivery (alias ITCM) or SSCM (or similar) and Asset Management experience preferred
Knowledge performance analysis.
Considerable knowledge of data analysis.

JobDescription:
About the job
At Afterglow Events and Product Management Consultancy Inc., we create the best events and experiences for your brand. We love working with companies who are committed to making a difference, and we're dedicated to helping you get there.

At Afterglow, we believe that your brand's success is our mission. That's why we offer a full suite of services to help you reach your goals.

We offer digital marketing expertise that covers a wide range of services, including social media management, content marketing, email campaigns, pay-per-click (PPC) advertising, and search engine optimization (SEO). We harness the power of the digital realm to connect your brand with your ideal customers.

Our branding and design team designs compelling brand identities that shine through every piece of marketing collateral. From logo design to brand messaging—and everything in between—we make sure your personality shines through every piece of creative collateral you produce.

Our creative team dreams up innovative and captivating campaigns that drive engagement with your audience. We think outside the box to create memorable experiences for them.

Data-driven decisions lead to successful outcomes; that's why we conduct in-depth market research to understand your target audience, competitors, and industry trends before creating well-informed strategies for each campaign or project you entrust us with.

The Role

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Data collection and cleansing: gathering data from various sources and performing data cleansing, organization, and processing
Data analysis and modeling: Utilize statistical and data analysis methods to analyze gaming-related data, uncover trends, patterns, and insights within the data to support business decisions.
Reporting and visualization: Prepare and generate data analysis reports, presenting complex data and analysis results in a clear and understandable manner to business teams and management to support decision-making.
Business insights and optimization recommendations: Provide business insights and optimization recommendations based on data analysis results
Collaboration with other departments: Collaborate closely with departments such as marketing, product, and technology teams, understand their needs, and provide data support and solutions." 

Ideal Profile

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or above, majoring in mathematics or statistics related majors, Master's degree is a plus
3 years of experience in data analysis of gaming or internet games
Familiar with user data attributes and lifecycle key indicators
Proficient in using mainstream data analysis software and can generate visual reports
